examples.text: ‘Are you going to come?’ ‘Perhaps. I'll see how I feel.’

definitions.definition: used when you want to make a statement or opinion less definite

examples.text: This is perhaps his best novel to date.
He had a difficult upbringing, which perhaps explains why he behaves like that.

definitions.definition: used when making a rough estimate

examples.text: a change which could affect perhaps 20 per cent of the population

definitions.definition: used when you agree or accept something unwillingly, or do not want to say that you think something is bad
used when making a polite request, offer or suggestion

examples.text: Perhaps it would be better if you came back tomorrow.
I think perhaps you've had enough to drink tonight.
Perhaps you’d like to have a shower before the others arrive.
Perhaps you would be good enough to let him know we are on our way.
